title: What is your favorite song? - Quora

response.answer_text: This week? These will be songs from the last 5 decades that I have always found a way to come back to. A lot of music when released seems fresh, satisfies you temporarily. These are songs I keep going back to. “Liberation and Poem 58″ - Chicago Transit Authority (Chicago’s first album) Terry Kath was a monster guitar player. The whole band was tight. “Blue Sky”- The Allman Brothers Doesn’t get any better than Dickey and Duane “Marque Moon”- Television or Tom Verlaine and Richard Lloyd “It Must Be Love”- Rickie Lee Jones One of my generations great voices “Runaway” - Aurora, Norwegian singer/songwriter. Her first album “All My Demons Greeting Me As A Friend” is just a year or so old and it turned my ears on like nothing else in the past 10 years or more. “Hey Sheriff” - The Backsliders (Live from Raleigh NC version) One of the best bar bands in America ca. 1992–95 “Cortez the Killer, Like A Hurricane, Down By The River” - Neil Young, OK , I can listen to Neil sing and play just about any time, any song. But the long guitar solos are my favorites “Europa”- Santana “Live” version off “Moonflower” LP How long can you hold a note Carlos ? “Soukora”- Ali Farka Toure and Ry Cooder This song is just my fave from an entire album of faves. The Album “Talking Timbuktu” was my introduction into the African music scene. There’s a lot of great music coming from that continent. Great guitar players like King Suny Ade ….Djelimady Tounkara ….., Franco (real name) François Luambo Makiadi,….. Diblo Dibala ….. just a wealth of great talent there. “Bye and Bye I’m Goin’ To See the King”- Blind Willie Johnson , called by many the “Greatest Blues slide guitar player EVER”. Not an exaggeration “Tracks Of My Tears” - Smokey Robinson and the Miracles- Everything Smokey Robinson does is worth listening to. “Everyday People” - Sly And The Family Stone “WE got to live together” Yes we do. I remember a time When music brought Black and White Americans together. “Girl Of Mine” - Blue Rodeo, Tells the story of a man’s crushing heart the most accurately I’ve ever heard it. “Too much to bear, too much I fall down drunk, too much I care……… “ “Diamond Mine” is one of my favorite albums “Rego Park Blues”-Ronnie Earl and The Broadcasters/with Bruce Katz 15 minutes of Blues magic. Guitar, B3, Who am I kidding. Every Ronnie Earl song is a favorite. Ronnie is a legend for a reason. “Why Modern Radio Is A-OK By Me” - Roman Candle, every word of this song rings true. “Broke Down”, and “Flowered Dresses” - Slaid Cleaves. “Flowered Dresses” is written by Karen Poston but he does a perfect job on this poignant love song of unfulfilled dreams that rings so true. “If I Could Olny fly” - Blaze Foley. Legendary Austin Singer/Songwriter. Called “The Duct Tape Messiah” for his habit of wearing duct tape covered suits. Died too young trying to stop another man from taking a beating. “No greater love for his fellow man, than he who would lay down his life …..” “Penny Black” - Bob Delevante , How much do I hope you forgive me darling? Enough to send a letter with the rarest stamp in the world attached. adly overlooked American Songwriter “Mediterranean Sundance” - Paco DeLucia, AL Dimeola, John McLaughlin 3 of the best guitarists in the world just playing with each other. “Don’t Dream It’s Over” - Crowded House, perfect song from a perfect album “Walking Into The Sun”- Driftwood. Kind of Bluegrass/Folk band with a Rock n Roll attitude from Binghampton NY. “Choctaw Bingo” James McMurtry Let’s go for a WILD ride to Uncle Slayton’s house for a family reunion. “Ghost Repeater” - Jeffrey Foucault- Songwriter’s songwriter “Doctor My Eyes, “For A Dancer” The Pretender” - Jackson Browne “Heroin” - Lou Reed (Rock n Roll Animal version) Rock music doesn’t get any scarier than this 24 Hours At A Time” - Marshall Tucker Band , Oh just let me hear anything that Toy Caldwell is playing guitar on. I could go on all night. I haven’t even touched Jazz or Classical or Bluegrass

I don’t have one. I like so much music, of such varying types, it would be impossible to narrow it down. Believe me, I’ve tried. But as I am suffering from MS-induced insomnia, I will take yet another stab at it. This is a list of the top 150 that comes to mind, in alphabetical order and subject to change at any given moment (because I am extremely mercurial on this subject). Please note: I have excluded instrumentals, classical music, musicals, opera, and comedy/parody. 7—Prince96 Tears—? and the Mysterians911 is a Joke—Public Enemy1816, the Year Without a Summer—RasputinaA Un Autre Comme Moi—Laurena SeguraAngel of the Small Death and the Codeine Scene—HozierAnna Stesia—PrinceApron Strings—Everything But The GirlAuthority Song—John Cougar MellencampBaby Can I Hold You—Tracey ChapmanBack to the River—Lily & MadeleineBad Reputation—Joan JettBeggin for Thread—BanksBeing Boring—-Merril BainbridgeThe Best Kind of Answer—Peter HimmelmanBikini Girls with Machine Guns—The CrampsBizarre Love Triangle—-both the New Order original & Frente! coverThe Book of Love—Peter GabrielBorn for a Purpose—Dr. AlimantadoCan’t Help Falling in Love (With You)—Elvis Presley’s original and UB40’s cover (they were my wedding songs!)Chasing Pavements—AdeleCircle—Edie Brickell & New BohemiansCities in Dust—-Siouxsie and the BansheesCitizens—Alice RussellCloser—Nine Inch NailsCrazy—Gnarls BarkleyDamn I Wish I Was Your Lover—Sophie B.
